examples.spanishExample: You estabas here when he lo estaba.
examples.englishTranslation: You were here when he was.
vocabIncluded: estaba/Verb, Verb/he/she/it was//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Imperfect
estabas/Verb, Verb/verb//2nd person singular "tú" ; 2nd person singular "vos" ; Imperfect
lo/Pronoun, Attribute/attribute to mean "that way", as in lo es, lo estoy/

examples.englishTranslation: We were the girls.
vocabIncluded: éramos/Verb, Verb/we were//1st person plural "nosotros" ; Imperfect

examples.englishTranslation: That is all.
vocabIncluded: es/Verb, Verb/it/he/she is//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative

examples.englishTranslation: Valentina is that way.
vocabIncluded: es/Verb, Verb/it/he/she is//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative

examples.englishTranslation: She's from Europe and the man is from Australia.
Why would you do this?
vocabIncluded: por qué/Cluster, Idiom/why? (either by itself or followed by a phrase/clause)/

examples.englishTranslation: I hope that that is OK.
vocabIncluded: que/Conjunction, Subordinating, potential subjunctive/conjunction for subordinated clause/

examples.englishTranslation: We can’t do that.

examples.spanishExample: No, ellos no son los winners.
examples.englishTranslation: No, they(m) aren’t the winners.
The guy was from Argentina.
vocabIncluded: era/Verb, Verb/he/she/it was//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Imperfect

examples.englishTranslation: He’s from Chile.
vocabIncluded: es/Verb, Verb/it/he/she is//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative

examples.englishTranslation: I’m a girl.

examples.spanishExample: Yo no era their amiga, but ella lo era.
examples.englishTranslation: I wasn’t their friend(f), but she was.
vocabIncluded: era/Verb, Verb/I was//1st person singular "yo" ; Imperfect
era/Verb, Verb/he/she/it was//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Imperfect
lo/Pronoun, Attribute/attribute to mean "that way", as in lo es, lo estoy/

examples.englishTranslation: They are from Peru.

examples.spanishExample: O es por ser amigos, o es por estar aquí.
examples.englishTranslation: Either it’s because of being friends, or it’s because of being here.
vocabIncluded: es/Verb, Verb/it/he/she is//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative
o/Conjunction, List/or between items in a list/

examples.englishTranslation: We were at the good houses.
vocabIncluded: estábamos/Verb, Verb/we were//1st person plural "nosotros" ; Imperfect

examples.spanishExample: La señora fue al lugar con el señor.
examples.englishTranslation: The lady went to the place with the gentleman.
vocabIncluded: fue/Verb, Verb/ir preterite (he/she/it went)//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Preterite

examples.englishTranslation: Good evening, sir! How is the Mrs.?
vocabIncluded: cómo/Adverb, Manner, other/only in question, not exclamation/
está/Verb, Verb/he/she/it is//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative

examples.spanishExample: Buenas tardes, señor, tengo sus *keys*por si las *you need.*
examples.englishTranslation: Good afternoon, sir, I have your(formal) keys in case you need them(f).
vocabIncluded: tengo/Verb, Verb//1st person singular "yo" ; Present indicative

examples.englishTranslation: She is leaving, as she wants to do.
vocabIncluded: irse/Other structure, Pronominal structure/any pronominal use/
va/Verb, Verb//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative

examples.spanishExample: Señor, vamos a estar aquí por si tiene tiempo.
examples.englishTranslation: Sir, we're going to be here in case you(formal) have time.
vocabIncluded: tiene/Verb, Verb//3rd person singular "él/ella/eso" ; Present indicative
vamos/Verb, Verb//1st person plural "nosotros" ; Present indicative

examples.spanishExample: Había ido con la mujer, pero ahora estamos en su casa.
examples.englishTranslation: I had gone with the woman, but now we are at her house.
vocabIncluded: estamos/Verb, Verb/we are//1st person plural "nosotros" ; Present indicative
había/Verb, Verb/I had (for participles)//1st person singular "yo" ; Imperfect

examples.spanishExample: Quiero que sean amigos por mí.
examples.englishTranslation: I want them to be friends(m) on my behalf.
vocabIncluded: que/Conjunction, Subordinating, potential subjunctive/conjunction for subordinated clause/
